content.description:
IMAGE 1: CENTER PIVOT IRRIGATION, CIMARRON, KANSAS, UNITED STATES

IMAGE 2: IRRIGATED TERRACES, YUANYANG, YUNNAN, CHINA

Source: Esri Data Partners

Cultural practices such as land use may vary across geographical locations because of physical geography and available resources. The images illustrate two different ways humans have modified the natural landscape.
content.question:
A. Describe the map scale shown in Image 1.

B. Explain an economic reason why people adopted the land use practice shown in Image 2.

C. Explain how irrigation may contribute to water resource depletion.

D. Explain the degree to which mechanized irrigation may allow crops to be grown in locations with arid climates.

E. Explain how government policies may reduce farmers’ economic risks associated with events such as severe weather or crop failure.
